title: Is Edpuzzle a good app for splicing video clips? - Quora

response.answer_text: Edpuzzle is a video platform that the teacher can use to create interactive online video lessons to improve student learning. Various types of questions, quizzes and comments are embedded in the video to boost the classroom engagement and check whether students truly understand the contents. Teachers’ own voice narration can be recorded onto the audio track and added to the videos to personalize the video lessons. It is an effective formative assessment to monitor student learning so as to provide ongoing feedback that can be used by instructors to improve their teaching. While the students are watching the videos, EDpuzzle can collect data on how many times they are watching each section, whether they are really understanding the content and the answering situations to the questions so as to guarantee the learning and teaching effects. Edpuzzle interactive videos can be made with videos found from a number of websites such as YouTube, TED, Vimeo, Khan Academy, Learn Zillion, National Geographic, etc, reused from other teachers’ video lessons or created and uploaded by teachers themselves. Edpuzzle creates the opportunity for the teacher to form a flipped classroom in which each student is assigned with interactive video lessons to watch at home to do the self-paced learning and join for doing more creative and meaningful activities and projects during the class time. Each video can be edited to create a lesson. Teachers can crop the video and use only what they need for their lesson. They can remove or shorten the video to be an appropriate length for the lesson they are teaching. You can't merge parts of a video together, nor can you combine different videos.   Click “Add cut” to splice the video into clips.  In summary, EDpuzzle is a good assistant for teachers to teach. It saves time for teachers and enable them to observe themselves and make a criticism for their teaching effects through recording the videos and watching later on. It turns videos into assessment tools for both teachers and students to examine their teaching and learning effects. It is even more a good video clips splicing tool for editing the videos to suite the teaching needs. Thanks for reading.
